articles.author: Jonathan M. Gitlin
articles.title: This EV smashed the world record for distance on a single charge | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: At 103 miles/kWh, the car is 25 times more efficient than any EV on sale.
articles.content: Enlarge/ This is muc22, and it set a new record for electric vehicle range on a single charge, driving for six days inside this hangar.14 with It must be the season for studentset world records. [+2804 chars]
articles.summary: A team of student engineers from the Technical University of Munich set a new world record for the fastest electric vehicle mph km h time. The car called muc looks more conventional than the Swiss speedster if only a little. The diminutive coupe in this case was built for efficiency and in a six day test at Munich airport it set the new distance record on a single charge for a non solar EV miles km with less battery capacity than many plug in hybrids just kWh. Next year Mercedes will launch an electric CLA that uses the powertrain technology demonstrated by the Vision EQXX concept.
articles.html_summary:
• A team of student engineers from the Technical University of Munich set a new world record for the fastest electric vehicle mph km h time.
  • The car called muc looks more conventional than the Swiss speedster if only a little.
  • The diminutive coupe in this case was built for efficiency and in a six day test at Munich airport it set the new distance record on a single charge for a non solar EV miles km with less battery capacity than many plug in hybrids just kWh.
  • Next year Mercedes will launch an electric CLA that uses the powertrain technology demonstrated by the Vision EQXX concept.

articles.author: Sean Lyngaas, CNN
articles.title: Caesars and MGM grapple with hacks as cybersecurity in Vegas is under scrutiny | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Hackers stole Social Security numbers and drivers license numbers from a significant number of loyalty program customers of Caesars Entertainment, the...
articles.content: Hackers stole Social Security numbers and drivers license numbers from a significant number of loyalty program customers of Caesars Entertainment, the hospitality and casino giant said Thursday.The [+3352 chars]
articles.summary: Hackers stole Social Security numbers and driver s license numbers from a significant number of loyalty program customers of Caesars Entertainment the hospitality and casino giant said Thursday. The disclosure comes as another big Las Vegas brand MGM Resorts is recovering from its own apparent cyberattack in which guests on Monday reported being unable to make room charges and access their rooms with digital keys. The pair of hacks has put a spotlight on the computer defenses of the multibillion dollar casino and hospitality business in Las Vegas which are ripe targets for cybercriminals to extort.
articles.html_summary:
• Hackers stole Social Security numbers and driver s license numbers from a significant number of loyalty program customers of Caesars Entertainment the hospitality and casino giant said Thursday.
  • The disclosure comes as another big Las Vegas brand MGM Resorts is recovering from its own apparent cyberattack in which guests on Monday reported being unable to make room charges and access their rooms with digital keys.
  • The pair of hacks has put a spotlight on the computer defenses of the multibillion dollar casino and hospitality business in Las Vegas which are ripe targets for cybercriminals to extort.

articles.author: Nathan Hodge
articles.title: Putin and Kim meet in Russia, but what are the main takeaways? | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Covering a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un might best be described as a caption contest The two held what the Kremlin called very substantive discussions on Wednesday, but beyond a few photo opportunitie
articles.content: Covering a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un might best be described as a caption contest The two held what the Kremlin called very substantive dis [+3715 chars]
articles.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un held what the Kremlin called very substantive discussions on Wednesday. The two sides held no press conference and issued no communique no deals were publicly announced. Putin appears to be extending a potential lifeline to Kim as his own government comes under sanction for the full scale invasion of Ukraine apparently dangling the carrot of access to Russian technology. If Russia is handing over this launch technology to North Korea then the world may potentially be witnessing the wider global fallout of Europe s largest land war since.
articles.html_summary:
• Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un held what the Kremlin called very substantive discussions on Wednesday.
  • The two sides held no press conference and issued no communique no deals were publicly announced.
  • Putin appears to be extending a potential lifeline to Kim as his own government comes under sanction for the full scale invasion of Ukraine apparently dangling the carrot of access to Russian technology.
  • If Russia is handing over this launch technology to North Korea then the world may potentially be witnessing the wider global fallout of Europe s largest land war since.

articles.author: By Tara Subramaniam and Andrew Raine, CNN
articles.title: Russias war in Ukraine | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has invited President Vladimir Putin to visit Pyongyang after the two leaders met Wednesday. US officials have warned Putin could use the summit to seek arms for his invasion of Ukraine. Follow for live updates.
articles.content: Vladimir Putin has said Russia is considering and discussing some military cooperation withNorth Korea, following a summit at which that countrys leader Kim Jong Un appeared to endorseMoscows war o [+2876 chars]
articles.summary: From CNN's Mariya Knight A Ukrainian missile attack Wednesday destroyed two Russian vessels in a Sevastopol shipyard, according to Ukraine's military.Andrii Yusov, a representative of the Defense Intelligence of Ukraine, named the vessels as the landing ship Minsk and the submarine Rostov-on-Don. "After the radio-location stations were disabled, the Navy used two Neptune cruise missiles to hit S300/400 Triumph launching complexes," the source said.From CNN staffThe Russian defense ministry said air defenses shot down 11 Ukrainian drones over Crimea early Thursday morning. Yusov said Wednesday that the vessels were beyond repair, and Ukraines Defense Intelligence doesnt want to get into the details of what weapon was used to hit the shipyard. It then appears to open fire as it gets closer.A statement from the Ukrainian military said its forces had attacked two patrol ships in the southwestern part of the Black Sea. We pushed them back to the shores of Crimea," he said.From CNN's Yulia Kesaieva and Andrew CareyVideo of what appears to be a Russian patrol ship coming under attack from naval drones in the Black Sea was released Thursday by Ukraines defense intelligence arm. Ukraine says it attacked two Russian ships in the early hours of Thursday.The night vision footage appears to have been recorded from one of the naval drones as it moves toward one vessel. During the operation, a group of Ukrainian intelligence officers encountered a Russian combat aircraft and shot it down with a man-portable air defense system, Pein said.

articles.author: Michelle Toh
articles.title: China is huge for chip designer Arm. Thats a risk for its new investors | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: As British chip designer Arm prepares to raise about $5 billion in an initial public offering (IPO) on Thursday, its China business has become a serious point of concern.
articles.content: As British chip designer Arm prepares to raise about $5 billion in an initial public offering (IPO) on Thursday, its China business has become a serious point of concern. The SoftBankowned firm us [+5779 chars]
articles.summary: Arm's mega IPO could be just around the corner, a year after the biggest chip deal in history fell apart Arm said Wednesday it priced its shares at $51 each, raising as much as $4.9 billion. The tally could rise to $5.2 billion if banks exercise an option to buy additional shares, valuing the chip designer at as much as $54.5 billion. The value of chips, and Arms technology, has maybe never been more in demand from the global economy, said Kyle Stanford, lead venture capital analyst at PitchBook. Although these historical issues did not have a material impact on our operations, any future failure to pay us the amounts we are owed  could have a material adverse effect on our business, Arm said. In its filing, Arm said it held just a 4.8% indirect ownership interest in Arm China, through a 10% non-voting stake in a SoftBank-controlled entity that owns less than half of the Chinese company. Neither we nor SoftBank Group control the operations of Arm China. Arm's IPO could value the chip company at $52 billion. Since April 2022, Wu and entities effectively controlled by him have lodged several lawsuits in Chinese courts against Arm China, seeking to challenge certain aspects of Arm Chinas corporate governance and the actions of Arm Chinas board of directors, Arm said in its filing.
articles.html_summary:
• Arm's mega IPO could be just around the corner, a year after the biggest chip deal in history fell apart Arm said Wednesday it priced its shares at $51 each, raising as much as $4.9 billion..
  • The tally could rise to $5.2 billion if banks exercise an option to buy additional shares, valuing the chip designer at as much as $54.5 billion..
  • “The value of chips, and Arm’s technology, has maybe never been more in demand from the global economy,” said Kyle Stanford, lead venture capital analyst at PitchBook..
  • “Although these historical issues did not have a material impact on our operations, any future failure to pay us the amounts we are owed … could have a material adverse effect on our business,” Arm said..
  • In its filing, Arm said it held just a “4.8% indirect ownership interest in Arm China,” through a 10% non-voting stake in a SoftBank-controlled entity that owns less than half of the Chinese company..
  • “Neither we nor SoftBank Group control the operations of Arm China.” Arm's IPO could value the chip company at $52 billion..

articles.author: Simone McCarthy
articles.title: The West fears a closer Russia and North Korea. China may not | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: A rare meeting between Russias Vladimir Putin and North Koreas Kim Jong Un at a space launch center in the Russian Far East earlier this week has triggered alarm from countries from South Korea and Japan to Ukraine, the United States and its partners in Eur
articles.content: Editors Note Sign up for CNNs Meanwhile in China newsletter which explores what you need to know about the countrys rise and how it impacts the world.A rare meeting between Russias Vladimir Putin  [+6445 chars]
articles.summary: But while China itself has appeared careful to avoid any large-scale military support of Russia, analysts say it may see potential support from North Korea as a boost to its own geopolitical calculus, where Russia remains a crucial partner amid rising tensions with the West. Putin talks military cooperation with Kim as North Korean leader endorses Russia's war on Ukraine Meanwhile, mutual support between the two sanctions-hit neighbors could mitigate international pressure on China over its strong ties to both. Beijing has already signaled what its official response to any military cooperation between the two would be, with its Foreign Ministry this week repeatedly telling reporters that Wednesdays meeting was between the two countries  implying its not Chinas business. (If) North Korea is really prepared to provide ammunition to Russia, it would be good for the Chinese expectation that Russia doesnt experience a major military defeat in the battlefield in Ukraine, said Li Mingjiang, an associate professor of international relations at Singapores Nanyang Technological University. And while its unclear exactly how much insight Chinese officials have into negotiations between North Korea and Russia, analysts say the meeting itself may not have gone forward with some level of consideration of Chinas ties to the two. Like Russia, it has backed past United Nations sanctions against North Koreas weapons programs  though its also been accused of practicing an arbitrary implementation of these controls and in recent years has blocked efforts to strengthen sanctions and led efforts to ease them. Rather than look to oppose or limit cooperation between Russia and North Korea, Beijing may see more benefits than risks for itself in this emerging axis, analysts say  particularly in regard to its great power rivalry with the US.
articles.html_summary:
• But while China itself has appeared careful to avoid any large-scale military support of Russia, analysts say it may see potential support from North Korea as a boost to its own geopolitical calculus, where Russia remains a crucial partner amid rising tensions with the West..
  • Putin talks military cooperation with Kim as North Korean leader endorses Russia's war on Ukraine Meanwhile, mutual support between the two sanctions-hit neighbors could mitigate international pressure on China over its strong ties to both..
  • Beijing has already signaled what its official response to any military cooperation between the two would be, with its Foreign Ministry this week repeatedly telling reporters that Wednesday’s meeting was “between the two countries” – implying it’s not China’s business..
  • “(If) North Korea is really prepared to provide ammunition to Russia, it would be good for the Chinese expectation that Russia doesn’t experience a major military defeat in the battlefield in Ukraine,” said Li Mingjiang, an associate professor of international relations at Singapore’s Nanyang Technological University..
  • And while it’s unclear exactly how much insight Chinese officials have into negotiations between North Korea and Russia, analysts say the meeting itself may not have gone forward with some level of consideration of China’s ties to the two..
  • Like Russia, it has backed past United Nations sanctions against North Korea’s weapons programs – though it’s also been accused of practicing an arbitrary implementation of these controls and in recent years has blocked efforts to strengthen sanctions and led efforts to ease them..

articles.title: Nose hairs, dead spiders and licking rocks are among this years Ig Nobel Prizewinning topics | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: How do you feel when you read the same word many times? Do people have an equal number of hairs in both their nostrils? Does electrifying your tongue change the taste of the food you are eating?  These were among the vital questions answered by the winners of
articles.content: How do you feel when you read the same word many, many, many times? Do people have an equal number of hairs in both their nostrils? Does electrifying your tongue change the taste of the food you are  [+3479 chars]
articles.summary: The Ig Nobel Prizes are an accolade that has no affiliation to the Nobel prizes. The prizes aim to celebrate the unusual honor the imaginative and spur people s interest in science medicine and technology. The Ig Nobel Prize s rd ceremony took place virtually on Thursday night with prizes awarded by genuine genuinely bemused Nobel laureates over Zoom. Each winner received a now defunct trillion Zimbabwe dollar bill and a pack of Ig Pseudo Cola Winners of the prizes represented countries including five researchers from the United States four from the UK and three from China.
articles.html_summary:
• The Ig Nobel Prizes are an accolade that has no affiliation to the Nobel prizes.
  • The prizes aim to celebrate the unusual honor the imaginative and spur people s interest in science medicine and technology.
  • The Ig Nobel Prize s rd ceremony took place virtually on Thursday night with prizes awarded by genuine genuinely bemused Nobel laureates over Zoom.
  • Each winner received a now defunct trillion Zimbabwe dollar bill and a pack of Ig Pseudo Cola Winners of the prizes represented countries including five researchers from the United States four from the UK and three from China.

articles.author: Helen Regan, Mariya Knight, Anna Chernova
articles.title: Kim Jong Un to visit fighter jet plant in Russia as Putin accepts invite to North Korea | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un continued his dayslong visit to Russia Friday, heading to an aircraft plant in the eastern city of KomsomolskonAmur, according to Russian state media, after the two sides said military cooperation was a possibility.
articles.content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un continued his dayslong visit to Russia Friday, heading to an aircraft plant in the eastern city of KomsomolskonAmur, according to Russian state media, after the two [+5602 chars]
articles.summary: All three countries expressed grave concerns over the discussions between the two leaders, which included topics related to military cooperation, including the development of intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs), despite repeated warnings from the international community, the statement said. Asked if the two leaders discussed military and technical cooperation during the talks, Peskov said it was a sensitive sphere of cooperation and reiterated Moscows commitment to further developing ties with Pyongyang. The tour of key sites in the Russian Far East region came after Putin previously said Russia is considering and discussing some military cooperation with North Korea, following a summit at which Kim appeared to endorse Moscows war on Ukraine. We see the potential for cooperation both in aircraft manufacturing and in other industries  this is especially relevant for achieving the tasks our countries face to achieve technological sovereignty, he said. Russias Deputy Prime Minister, Denis Manturov, said after the tour that Moscow saw the potential for cooperation both in aircraft manufacturing and in other industries with North Korea, according to a Russian government press release Friday on its Telegram channel.  Vladimir Putin has said Russia will build good neighborly relations with North Korea on the fourth day of Kim Jong Uns lengthy visit to the country, amid warnings from the West that Moscow must not break international sanctions targeting Pyongyang. But he also said there were areas open for discussion and consideration, suggesting potential points of cooperation.
articles.html_summary:
• “All three countries expressed grave concerns over the discussions between the two leaders, which included topics related to military cooperation, including the development of intercontinental ballistic missiles (ICBMs), despite repeated warnings from the international community,” the statement said..
  • Asked if the two leaders discussed military and technical cooperation during the talks, Peskov said it was a “sensitive sphere of cooperation” and reiterated Moscow’s commitment to further developing ties with Pyongyang..
  • The tour of key sites in the Russian Far East region came after Putin previously said Russia is considering and discussing some military cooperation with North Korea, following a summit at which Kim appeared to endorse Moscow’s war on Ukraine..
  • “We see the potential for cooperation both in aircraft manufacturing and in other industries – this is especially relevant for achieving the tasks our countries face to achieve technological sovereignty,” he said..
  • Russia’s Deputy Prime Minister, Denis Manturov, said after the tour that Moscow saw “the potential for cooperation both in aircraft manufacturing and in other industries” with North Korea, according to a Russian government press release Friday on its Telegram channel..
  • Vladimir Putin has said Russia will build “good neighborly relations” with North Korea on the fourth day of Kim Jong Un’s lengthy visit to the country, amid warnings from the West that Moscow must not break international sanctions targeting Pyongyang..

articles.author: Edward-Isaac Dovere
articles.title: Biden campaign plots longgame strategy as Democrats fears of a Trump win spike | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: President Joe Bidens aides privately acknowledge a rematch with Donald Trump in 2024 could be his best path to reelection, but they are terrified by what would happen if he lost  which operatives on his campaign and throughout the Democratic Party worry is
articles.content: President Joe Bidens aides privately acknowledge a rematch with Donald Trump in 2024 could be his best path to reelection, but they are terrified by what would happen if he lost which operatives on h [+11585 chars]
articles.summary: Longtime Democratic megadonor Jeffrey Katzenberg is serving as campaign co-chair and trying to bring his usual campaign finance rainmaking in-house while former ambassador Rufus Gifford left the State Department for a finance job, traveling the country to make direct appeals.  President Joe Bidens aides privately acknowledge a rematch with Donald Trump in 2024 could be his best path to reelection, but they are terrified by what would happen if he lost  which operatives on his campaign and throughout the Democratic Party worry is a very real possibility. They are testing not just which voters the campaign is reaching and what the campaign is saying, but how the voters are being reached, how theyre processing the information  and whether any of that can be turned into votes. The reelection campaign is laying the groundwork for an argument that goes beyond Trump in case they instead face one of the three or four GOP candidates they still see as having a chance. As for Steyer, Tom believes the Biden administration has been one of the best in history on climate, and he will be enthusiastically supporting President Bidens re-election campaign, said adviser Doug Rubin. At the end of the day, money is not going to be a problem, said the famous trial lawyer, who is still waiting to firm up a Florida event he has been talking with the Biden campaign about hosting since the spring. Its a malaise about the president that operatives keep noting that goes beyond a slew of national polls  including one from CNN last week  that show a negative view of the presidents performance.
articles.html_summary:
• Longtime Democratic megadonor Jeffrey Katzenberg is serving as campaign co-chair and trying to bring his usual campaign finance rainmaking in-house while former ambassador Rufus Gifford left the State Department for a finance job, traveling the country to make direct appeals..
  • President Joe Biden’s aides privately acknowledge a rematch with Donald Trump in 2024 could be his best path to reelection, but they are terrified by what would happen if he lost – which operatives on his campaign and throughout the Democratic Party worry is a very real possibility..
  • They are testing not just which voters the campaign is reaching and what the campaign is saying, but how the voters are being reached, how they’re processing the information – and whether any of that can be turned into votes..
  • The reelection campaign is laying the groundwork for an argument that goes beyond Trump in case they instead face one of the three or four GOP candidates they still see as having a chance..
  • As for Steyer, “Tom believes the Biden administration has been one of the best in history on climate, and he will be enthusiastically supporting President Biden’s re-election campaign,” said adviser Doug Rubin..
  • “At the end of the day, money is not going to be a problem,” said the famous trial lawyer, who is still waiting to firm up a Florida event he has been talking with the Biden campaign about hosting since the spring..

articles.author: Scharon Harding
articles.title: Google extends Chromebook support from 8 years to 10 after heightened backlash | Makemetechie.com Summary
articles.description: Automatic Chromebook expiration dates are fundamentally flawed, critics say.
articles.content: 7 with Google announced today that its extending Chromebooks automatic update support from 8 years to 10 years for devices released from 2019 and later. The move follows increasing criticism from [+4558 chars]
articles.summary: Google announced today that it s extending Chromebooks automatic update support from years to years for devices released from and later. The move follows increasing criticism from consumers schools and advocacy groups around the many Chromebooks in use and on sale with looming death dates. For Chromebooks released before and already in use users and IT admins will have the option to extend automatic updates to years from the platform s release when they receive their last automatic update. Ten years of support is a notable achievement for Chromebooks which are often budget priced.
articles.html_summary:
• Google announced today that it s extending Chromebooks automatic update support from years to years for devices released from and later.
  • The move follows increasing criticism from consumers schools and advocacy groups around the many Chromebooks in use and on sale with looming death dates.
  • For Chromebooks released before and already in use users and IT admins will have the option to extend automatic updates to years from the platform s release when they receive their last automatic update.
  • Ten years of support is a notable achievement for Chromebooks which are often budget priced.
